item.title: Building Endurance the Right Way
item.description: Notes taken while listening to Building Endurance the Right Way Aspects to Endurance - Cardio & Muscular How to develop cardio Steady state exercise - run at particular speed not too fast Cause: Heart stretches when you increase heart rate upto a certain point which increases stroke volume(means a bigger heart) Running at increased heart rate (90% +), heart is twitching and not effective Run at pace where you can have a sustained conversation Interval Training Based on Inertia Run at 80-90% and then start jogging or walking, heart is still beating hard, extra volume of blood is moving which stretches the heart Interval found usefull after period of steady state training Easy to go wrong Walk till you can talk How to Develop Muscular Need/Develop mitochondria in muscle cells Easy to do in slow fibers and harder to do in fast fibers Make muscle oxidative, enduring not polluting 3 main energy systems creatine phosphate clean burning and for short durations aerobic less powerfull longer lasting glyocalytic inbetween Train in a way to produce less acid For slow fibers moving right below anerobic threshold Anaerobic is intensity where acid is accumulating at rate where the body can dispose at the same rate above anaerobic threshold when you are failing the talk test For fast fibers N/A :) because I had stopped watching the video by this point of time

item.title: Nightcrawler
item.description: For the first time ever, I ran a 4k in the night at 11:30 PM around my apartment after a late night software release. People talk about starting your day fresh after a run inconveniently missing out the part about waking up early in the morning, and hustling after the run to get to work on time. In contrast when you run at night, you really don't have anything to get back to except your comfy bed and when you do get back you obviously will sleep like a log cause you are exhausted after running.

item.title: Bangalore Half Marathon 2019 Race Report
item.description: Overall my memory of the race is very hazy and I only remember very specific parts of the race. The beginning part(5-6 kms) of the race involved a lot of shuffling and moving around slow runners. The course through Cubbon park had a chilly weather and the air was very fresh. I remember while running through Cubbon park at a later part of the race I saw this one park filled with tons of dogs running around playfully and some even cheering for me :)
